answers.text:
Brian, you can consider contacting the US Composting Council, which is a national, non-profit trade and professional organization promoting the recycling of organic materials through composting. Their website is http://www.compostingcouncil.org/.  Resources on recyling, composting and environmental management and regulatory information such as this is available at the Local Government Environmental Assistance Network, www.lgean.org  that is managed by ICMA.

author: Brian Halverson
text:
We are planning on rolling out organics collection (yard trimmings, fruits and vegetables) for 30,000 residents by the end of the fiscal year.  However, both major local composters can handle many other materials like meat, bones, dairy, soiled paper, bio plastics etc.
My question is, for those of you with organics collection programs, what materials do you accept/not accept and why (e.g. contamination, lack of a processor, lack of citizen approval)?  (If you are able to reply, please let me know how many residential customers you have.)
Thank you in advance for you input!
title: Organics Collection
